div.head: TO THE NOBLE and vertuous Ladie, the Ladie Spencer of Ofley.
div.p:
IT may seeme a solecisme to match a Lady and a battaile: for Trumpets and Fifes are harsh accents in a Ladies eare; and a Battaile though but in arras is terrible: But this makes the constuction good. I see your virtue (most Honourd Lady) stand higher then your Sex, and in that I know that the atcheiuements of actiue spirits are more welcome to a masculine vertue then a soft discourse.
Besides there hath euer beene a sympathie betwixt Ladies and Martialists, and the Doues of Venus make their nests sometime in a Soldiers helmet: Nay (to passe true stories) the bookes of Knight errantrie were but shrunken things, if wee tooke out of them aduentures done for Ladies. I hope the reconcilementis made, if not, your Ladiship is mercifull; and though you detect an errour in my Iudgement, you shall finde an infallibilitie in his deuotion, who here laies his hand vpon your Altar for protection.
